headline.main: $500,000 Gift Aids Community Health; Gift Aids Health Project

docs.lead_paragraph: A PRIVATE fund-raising drive led by some of the state's most prominent citizens and corporations in support of the College of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey has produced a major new financial commitment of $500,000 toward community programs.
docs.snippet: A PRIVATE fund-raising drive led by some of the state's most prominent citizens and corporations in support of the  College of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey has produced a major new financial commitment of $500,000 toward community programs.

headline.main: Food-Day Dinner at the White House Offers the Meat of Controversy

byline.original: By DEE WEDEMEYER Special to The New York Times

docs.abstract: Article on meatless dinner served at White House; illus (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 21 "I'd like the recipe," said Senator Mark O. Hatfield, the Oregon Republican, as he took a sip of the black-bean soup at the controversial meatless White House dinner tonight. "The first thing my wife is going to say is 'Well, did you get the recipe?'"
